SKILLS.PAGE_INTRODUCTION:
Hi! I'm Federico.

My journey into software development began with a spark of curiosity in a place that would shape my future: Blender. Just a few years after its release, I discovered this powerful 3D tool and was instantly captivated by its possibilities. As I designed intricate 3D environments, I felt a growing desire to go beyond static visuals—I wanted to bring these digital spaces to life, making them interactive, dynamic, and accessible from any device. That vision fueled my passion for programming, setting me on a path to turn imagination into interactive experiences.

I first specialized in back-end development, particularly with Spring Framework, where I learned to design robust, secure, and high-performance systems. Yet, something was missing: the connection between 3D and the server. It was only when I entered the professional world that I found this missing link—through front-end development. Working on large-scale projects allowed me to gain solid experience in building reliable and efficient applications while exploring innovative ways to present data.

Today, my goal is clear: to build professional applications that integrate 3D to offer immersive and dynamic data visualization. I want to push the boundaries of how users interact with information, creating experiences that are not only functional but also captivating. My background, combining 3D creation, back-end, and front-end development, gives me a unique perspective and strong technical expertise to tackle these challenges.

I am passionate about merging the power of data with the beauty of 3D, and I am determined to keep innovating in this field.

FRONT_END_FRAMEWORKS.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
In the ever-evolving world of web development, choosing the right front-end framework is essential for crafting responsive, efficient, and user-friendly applications. With a wealth of options available, it’s vital to leverage technologies that provide scalability, maintainability, and a seamless user experience.

In this section, I showcase my expertise with three leading frameworks: Next.js, React, and Angular. Each of these technologies brings its own set of strengths, enabling me to build dynamic, high-performance web applications tailored to meet diverse requirements.

By harnessing the power of React alongside its Next.js framework, I’ve developed fast, SEO-friendly applications with server-side rendering and static site generation, all while crafting modular, reusable UI components that elevate interactivity and streamline maintainability. On the other hand, Angular has equipped me with a structured, enterprise-grade approach to building large-scale applications with strong type safety and a robust architecture.

Combining these modern tools and methodologies ensures that every project I undertake is not only functional and efficient, but also scalable and designed for long-term success.

NEXTJS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Next.js is a powerful open-source React framework designed to build fast, scalable, and SEO-friendly web applications. Developed and maintained by Vercel, it provides features like server-side rendering (SSR), static site generation (SSG), and API routes, allowing developers to create dynamic and high-performance web experiences. With its file-based routing system and built-in optimizations like image optimization and code splitting, Next.js simplifies development while improving user experience. It also supports hybrid rendering, enabling developers to choose between static and dynamic content generation. Ideal for modern web development, Next.js is widely used for building everything from simple websites to complex applications.

REACT.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: React is a popular open-source JavaScript library used for building user interfaces, particularly for single-page applications. Created and maintained by Meta (formerly Facebook), React allows developers to create reusable UI components that efficiently update and render as application data changes. It employs a declarative programming approach, making the code more predictable and easier to debug. At its core, React uses a virtual DOM to optimize rendering performance by updating only the parts of the UI that change, rather than reloading the entire page. React is highly extensible, integrates seamlessly with other libraries or frameworks, and is widely used for creating dynamic and responsive web applications.

ANGULAR.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Angular is a powerful open-source framework developed and maintained by Google for building dynamic and scalable web applications. Known for its comprehensive nature, Angular provides a complete solution for front-end development, including tools for building interactive user interfaces, managing application state, and handling routing. It uses TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript, and follows a component-based architecture, making code modular, reusable, and maintainable. Angular’s two-way data binding ensures that changes in the UI reflect in the underlying data model and vice versa, simplifying real-time updates. With its robust features, including dependency injection and a rich ecosystem of tools, Angular is ideal for creating complex, enterprise-level applications.

FRONT_END_LIBRARIES.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
In modern front-end development, libraries are crucial for enhancing functionality, optimizing performance, and simplifying complex tasks. In this section, I highlight my experience with a variety of powerful libraries that extend the capabilities of frameworks like Next.js, Angular, and React.

By leveraging these libraries, I can efficiently manage application states, handle data interactions, and create dynamic user interfaces. These tools simplify complex tasks and enhance the overall development process, ensuring that applications are both performant and scalable, all while delivering an intuitive and seamless user experience.

GOOGLE_MAPS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: The Google Maps API is a suite of powerful tools and services provided by Google that allows developers to integrate interactive maps, location-based features, and geospatial data into web and mobile applications. It offers a wide range of functionalities, including displaying customizable maps, adding markers, drawing routes, calculating distances, and providing real-time traffic and transit information. The API also supports advanced features like geocoding (converting addresses to coordinates), reverse geocoding (converting coordinates to addresses), and Places API for location search and details. With its robust documentation, extensive customization options, and support for multiple platforms, the Google Maps API is widely used for applications such as ride-sharing services, delivery tracking, travel planning, and location-based analytics. It is available in various forms, including JavaScript, Android, and iOS SDKs, making it a versatile choice for developers building location-aware applications.

NEXT_INTL.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: next-intl is a library designed to simplify internationalization (i18n) in Next.js applications, enabling developers to build multilingual websites with ease. It provides tools for managing translations, formatting dates, numbers, and currencies according to locale-specific conventions, and handling language routing. With next-intl, developers can store translations in JSON or other formats, dynamically load them based on the user's locale, and seamlessly integrate them into their Next.js components. It supports features like static generation (SSG) and server-side rendering (SSR), ensuring optimal performance and SEO for multilingual sites. By abstracting the complexities of i18n, next-intl helps developers create globally accessible web applications while maintaining clean and maintainable code. It's a popular choice for Next.js projects requiring robust internationalization support.

FORMIK.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Formik is a popular open-source library for building and managing forms in React applications. It simplifies form handling by providing a set of tools and utilities to manage form state, validation, submission, and error handling in a declarative and efficient way. Formik integrates seamlessly with React, allowing developers to create complex forms with minimal boilerplate code. It supports features like field-level validation, form-level validation, and asynchronous validation, and works well with validation libraries like Yup. Formik also provides helpers for handling form reset, dirty state tracking, and field arrays, making it a versatile choice for forms of any complexity. Its intuitive API and focus on developer experience have made it a go-to solution for form management in modern React applications.

MUI.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: MUI (formerly Material-UI) is a popular React component library that implements Google's Material Design principles, providing a comprehensive suite of pre-built, customizable UI components for building modern, responsive web applications. It includes a wide range of components such as buttons, dialogs, forms, navigation menus, and data tables, all designed with a consistent and visually appealing aesthetic. MUI emphasizes flexibility, allowing developers to easily customize themes, styles, and component behavior using its powerful theming system and CSS-in-JS solution. It also supports server-side rendering (SSR) and is optimized for performance, making it suitable for large-scale applications. With its extensive documentation, active community, and integration with popular tools like React and Next.js, MUI is a go-to choice for developers looking to create polished, user-friendly interfaces efficiently.

MOBILE.SECTION_DESCRIPTION: While my expertise has primarily focused on web development, mobile development is the next frontier I am excited to explore. Although I don’t yet have deep expertise in building mobile applications, I am actively expanding my skills in this area. I’m particularly interested in integrating real-time 3D experiences into mobile apps, combining my passion for interactive 3D with the potential of mobile platforms. This will be my next destination in the evolution of my technical journey, as I strive to create responsive, user-friendly apps that offer seamless, immersive experiences across devices.

IONIC.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Ionic is an open-source framework for building cross-platform mobile and web applications using web technologies like HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. It provides a rich library of UI components and tools that mimic native mobile app behavior, enabling developers to create high-quality, performant apps for iOS, Android, and the web from a single codebase. Ionic integrates seamlessly with popular front-end frameworks like Angular, React, and Vue, offering flexibility in development. It also supports Capacitor, a native runtime that allows access to device features such as cameras, GPS, and file systems. With its focus on developer productivity, pre-built components, and strong community support, Ionic is a popular choice for building hybrid apps that deliver a native-like experience across multiple platforms.

REAL_TIME_THREED.SECTION_DESCRIPTION: The world of real-time 3D on the web represents an exciting frontier, offering opportunities for highly interactive and immersive user experiences. In this section, I highlight my expertise in crafting stunning 3D visuals through WebGPU, WebGL, and powerful libraries such as Three.js, React-three-fiber, and Babylon.js. By harnessing these technologies, I bring 3D objects, environments, and animations to life directly in the browser, enabling dynamic visual storytelling and seamless user interactions. Whether it's for gaming, data visualization, or creating immersive web applications, my skills in real-time 3D development allow me to push the boundaries of what's possible, delivering cutting-edge, visually captivating experiences on the web.

WEBGPU.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: WebGPU is a cutting-edge, low-level graphics and compute API designed to bring high-performance GPU capabilities to web applications, succeeding WebGL with more advanced features and closer-to-the-metal control. Inspired by modern APIs like Vulkan, Metal, and Direct3D 12, WebGPU offers improved performance, cross-platform compatibility, and support for both graphics rendering and general-purpose compute tasks, such as machine learning and data processing. It introduces WGSL (WebGPU Shading Language) for safer and more efficient shader programming, along with fine-grained resource management and asynchronous operations to optimize performance. Supported by major browsers like Chrome, Firefox, and Safari, WebGPU is ideal for 3D gaming, data visualization, AR/VR, and other demanding web applications, providing a future-proof foundation for modern web development.

WEBGL.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: WebGL (Web Graphics Library) is a widely-used JavaScript API for rendering 2D and 3D graphics in web browsers without the need for plugins. Based on OpenGL ES, WebGL allows developers to create interactive graphics, animations, and visualizations directly within the browser by leveraging the power of the GPU. It provides a familiar programming model for those experienced with OpenGL, making it accessible for creating games, data visualizations, and immersive web experiences. While WebGL has been a cornerstone of web-based graphics for years, it is now being complemented by more modern APIs like WebGPU, which offer greater performance and advanced features. WebGL remains a popular choice for its simplicity, broad browser support, and ability to deliver rich graphical content on the web.

THREEJS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Three.js is a popular, open-source JavaScript library that simplifies the creation and rendering of 3D graphics in web browsers using WebGL, WebGPU, or other rendering backends. Designed to be intuitive and developer-friendly, Three.js abstracts the complexities of low-level graphics APIs, allowing developers to quickly build 3D scenes, animations, and interactive experiences with minimal code. It provides a wide range of features, including lighting, materials, textures, cameras, and geometric primitives, as well as support for advanced techniques like shadows, particle systems, and post-processing effects. Widely used for games, data visualizations, AR/VR applications, and creative web projects, Three.js is a powerful tool for bringing high-quality 3D content to the web, making it accessible to both beginners and experienced developers.

REACT_THREE_FIBER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: React Three Fiber is a powerful React renderer for Three.js that allows developers to build 3D graphics and interactive experiences declaratively using React's component-based architecture. By bridging the gap between Three.js and React, it enables seamless integration of 3D elements into React applications, making it easier to manage state, props, and lifecycle methods within 3D scenes. React Three Fiber abstracts the complexities of Three.js while retaining its full capabilities, offering a intuitive way to create 3D objects, animations, and effects using familiar React patterns. It is widely used for creating immersive web applications, games, data visualizations, and AR/VR experiences, combining the flexibility of Three.js with the efficiency and scalability of React. Ideal for both beginners and advanced developers, React Three Fiber simplifies 3D development while maintaining high performance and creative freedom.

BABYLONJS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Babylon.js is a powerful, open-source 3D rendering engine and framework for building interactive web-based 3D applications and games. Built on WebGL, WebGPU, and WebXR, Babylon.js provides a comprehensive set of tools for creating high-performance 3D graphics, animations, and immersive experiences directly in the browser. It features a user-friendly API, a rich library of pre-built materials, lighting, and camera systems, and supports advanced techniques like physics simulations, particle systems, and post-processing effects. Babylon.js also integrates seamlessly with modern web development workflows, offering support for TypeScript, React, and other frameworks. With its extensive documentation, active community, and focus on ease of use, Babylon.js is a go-to choice for developers looking to create stunning 3D content for the web, including games, virtual reality (VR), augmented reality (AR), and data visualizations.

STYLING_AND_ANIMATION.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
In web development, creating visually appealing and responsive designs is essential for delivering exceptional user experiences. My expertise lies in crafting clean, maintainable, and scalable stylesheets that prioritize both aesthetics and functionality. I focus on writing organized and efficient code, using modern methodologies to ensure consistency and adaptability across projects. Whether it’s building responsive layouts, implementing reusable design systems, or optimizing for performance, I strive to create interfaces that are intuitive and user-friendly.

To enhance interactivity and engagement, I also integrate dynamic elements such as animations and transitions, ensuring they are smooth and performant. My goal is to strike a balance between creativity and technical precision, delivering designs that not only look great but also provide a seamless and enjoyable experience across all devices. By focusing on functionality and user-centric design, I aim to create interfaces that are both visually impactful and highly effective.

SASS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Sass (Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets) is a powerful CSS preprocessor that extends the capabilities of traditional CSS, making it easier to write and maintain stylesheets. It introduces features like variables, nested rules, mixins, functions, and inheritance, which help developers write cleaner, more modular, and reusable code. Sass files are written in either the .scss (Sassy CSS) or .sass (indented syntax) format and then compiled into standard CSS for use in web projects. Its advanced features enable dynamic styling, reduce redundancy, and improve organization, making it a favorite among developers for building complex and scalable designs. Sass is widely supported in modern front-end workflows and integrates seamlessly with build tools like Webpack, Gulp, and frameworks like Next.js, React and Angular.

TAILWIND.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework that enables developers to build modern, responsive user interfaces directly in their HTML by applying small, reusable utility classes. Unlike traditional CSS frameworks that provide pre-designed components, Tailwind offers low-level utility classes for properties like padding, margin, typography, and colors, giving developers complete control over the design without writing custom CSS. This approach promotes consistency, speeds up development, and makes it easier to create custom designs without leaving the HTML. Tailwind is highly customizable through its configuration file, allowing developers to define their design system, such as color palettes, breakpoints, and spacing scales. It also supports features like dark mode, responsive design, and Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation for optimized performance. Tailwind CSS is widely used in modern web development for its flexibility, efficiency, and ability to streamline the design process.

GSAP.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: GSAP (GreenSock Animation Platform) is a high-performance JavaScript animation library used to create smooth, complex, and interactive animations for the web. Known for its speed, flexibility, and robustness, GSAP allows developers to animate virtually any property of DOM elements, SVG, canvas, or even JavaScript objects. It provides a rich set of tools, including timelines for sequencing animations, easing functions for natural motion, and plugins for advanced features like scroll-triggered animations, morphing, and physics-based effects. GSAP is framework-agnostic, making it compatible with React, Vue, Angular, and other libraries, while its small file size and optimized performance ensure smooth animations even on low-powered devices. Widely used for creating engaging user interfaces, storytelling animations, and interactive web experiences, GSAP is a go-to solution for developers seeking professional-grade animation capabilities.

GRAPHICS.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
In the realm of graphic design and digital art, I utilize a wide range of powerful tools to create visually striking and highly refined assets. With Photoshop and Illustrator, I design intricate graphics, illustrations, and user interfaces that are both functional and aesthetically appealing. These tools enable me to meticulously craft everything from branding materials to web layouts, ensuring that every visual element contributes to the overall user experience.

When it comes to 3D design, Blender plays a central role in bringing my ideas to life with exceptional realism and detail. Whether it’s creating 3D models, environments, or animations, Blender provides the flexibility and power to produce high-quality assets for a variety of applications, from web visuals to immersive environments. Additionally, with Substance 3D, I’m able to create stunning, lifelike textures and materials that add depth and authenticity to my 3D designs. This suite of tools empowers me to push the boundaries of creative expression and deliver polished, professional visuals that elevate the digital experience.

By combining these tools, I’m able to blend 2D and 3D design seamlessly, ensuring that every project—whether static or interactive—delivers a captivating visual experience that resonates with users.

PHOTOSHOP.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Photoshop is a professional-grade raster graphics editing software developed by Adobe, widely regarded as the industry standard for image editing, photo manipulation, and digital art creation. It offers a vast array of tools and features, including layers, masks, filters, brushes, and advanced color correction, enabling users to create, edit, and enhance images with precision and creativity. Photoshop supports a wide range of file formats and integrates seamlessly with other Adobe Creative Cloud applications like Illustrator, Lightroom, and Premiere Pro. It is used by photographers, graphic designers, web developers, and artists for tasks such as photo retouching, compositing, digital painting, and designing user interfaces. With its powerful capabilities and continuous updates, Photoshop remains an essential tool for professionals and enthusiasts in the visual arts and design industries.

ILLUSTRATOR.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Adobe Illustrator is a professional vector graphics editor developed by Adobe, widely used for creating scalable illustrations, logos, icons, typography, and complex designs. Unlike raster-based tools like Photoshop, Illustrator uses vector graphics, which are resolution-independent and can be scaled infinitely without losing quality. It offers a robust set of tools, including the Pen Tool for precise path creation, Shape Builder for combining shapes, and Gradient Mesh for realistic shading. Illustrator also supports advanced typography, artboards for multi-page designs, and integration with other Adobe Creative Cloud apps like Photoshop and InDesign. Its versatility and precision make it a go-to tool for graphic designers, illustrators, and branding professionals, enabling the creation of high-quality, print-ready, and digital-ready artwork.

BLENDER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Blender is a free and open-source 3D creation suite used for modeling, animation, rendering, compositing, video editing, and more. It provides a comprehensive set of tools for creating 3D assets, including polygonal modeling, sculpting, texturing, and rigging, as well as advanced features like physics simulations, particle systems, and fluid dynamics. Blender's powerful rendering engine, Cycles, supports photorealistic rendering, while its real-time engine, Eevee, enables fast previews and interactive workflows. It also includes a built-in video editor, motion tracking, and support for scripting with Python, making it highly customizable. Widely used by artists, animators, game developers, and VFX professionals, Blender is a versatile and accessible tool for creating high-quality 3D content for films, games, and interactive applications.

SUBSTANCE_PAINTER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Substance Painter is a industry-leading 3D texture painting software developed by Adobe, designed for creating highly detailed and realistic textures for 3D models. It offers a powerful set of tools for painting, sculpting, and applying materials directly onto 3D surfaces, using features like smart materials, particle brushes, and procedural effects. Substance Painter supports PBR (Physically Based Rendering) workflows, enabling artists to create textures that interact realistically with light and environment. It also integrates seamlessly with other 3D software and game engines like Blender, Maya, Unreal Engine, and Unity, making it a go-to tool for game developers, VFX artists, and 3D designers. With its intuitive interface, real-time feedback, and extensive material library, Substance Painter streamlines the texturing process, allowing artists to achieve professional-quality results efficiently.

BACK_END_FRAMEWORKS.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
My journey into back-end development began during my studies, where I focused extensively on the Spring Framework. This foundation provided me with a deep understanding of building robust, scalable, and secure server-side applications. Spring's powerful features, such as dependency injection, security, and transaction management, have equipped me to create efficient, high-performance systems.

In addition to my academic background, I gained hands-on experience with Django while working professionally. Django’s clean, pragmatic design and rapid development capabilities have enabled me to build dynamic, data-driven applications. These combined experiences in both Spring and Django allow me to design and implement solid back-end systems that integrate seamlessly with front-end technologies, delivering comprehensive full-stack solutions.

SPRING.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Spring is a powerful, open-source Java framework designed to simplify the development of enterprise-level applications. It provides a comprehensive programming and configuration model for building robust, scalable, and maintainable applications. Spring's core features include dependency injection (DI) and inversion of control (IoC), which promote loose coupling and easier testing. It also offers modules for data access, transaction management, security, and web development, including Spring MVC and Spring Boot. Spring Boot, in particular, simplifies the setup and deployment of standalone, production-grade applications with minimal configuration. Known for its flexibility, modularity, and extensive ecosystem, Spring is widely used for building RESTful APIs, microservices, and cloud-native applications, making it a cornerstone of modern Java development.

DJANGO.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Django is a high-level, open-source Python web framework designed to help developers build secure, scalable, and maintainable web applications quickly. Known for its "batteries-included" philosophy, Django comes with a wide range of built-in features, such as an ORM (Object-Relational Mapper) for database interactions, an admin panel for content management, and robust authentication and authorization systems. It follows the Model-View-Template (MVT) architectural pattern, promoting clean and reusable code. Django also emphasizes security, offering protection against common vulnerabilities like SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS). With its extensive documentation, active community, and support for rapid development, Django is a popular choice for building everything from simple websites to complex, data-driven applications like content management systems (CMS), e-commerce platforms, and social networks.

DATA.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
Data management and integration are fundamental to creating dynamic, data-driven applications, and I have gained experience working with a diverse set of tools and technologies to handle complex data tasks efficiently. I use Redux for state management, ensuring that application data flows seamlessly across components and maintains consistency throughout the user interface. For handling API interactions, I rely on GraphQL, which enables me to efficiently query and manipulate data with flexible, declarative requests.

When it comes to databases, I have hands-on experience with both PostgreSQL and MySQL, allowing me to design and manage relational databases that are scalable, reliable, and optimized for performance. For testing APIs and ensuring smooth communication between services, I rely on Postman, which simplifies API requests and response validation. To streamline database management and data visualization, I use DBeaver, which provides an intuitive interface for working with databases, allowing me to query, manage, and optimize my data structures effectively.

By combining these tools and technologies, I am able to ensure that data is managed efficiently, making every application more responsive, reliable, and scalable.

REDUX.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Redux is a predictable state management library for JavaScript applications, commonly used with frameworks like React, Angular, or Vue to manage application state in a centralized and consistent way. It operates on the principle of a single, immutable "store" that holds the entire state of the application, making it easier to debug, test, and maintain complex applications. Redux uses a unidirectional data flow, where state changes are triggered by dispatching actions, which are processed by pure functions called reducers to update the state. This predictable pattern ensures that the state is updated in a controlled and traceable manner. Redux is particularly useful for large-scale applications with shared state across multiple components, enabling developers to manage state more efficiently and avoid prop-drilling. While it requires some boilerplate code, its ecosystem of middleware (like Redux Thunk or Redux Saga) and developer tools make it a powerful choice for state management in modern web development.

GRAPHQL.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: GraphQL is a modern query language and runtime for APIs that enables clients to request exactly the data they need, nothing more and nothing less. Unlike traditional REST APIs, where endpoints return fixed data structures, GraphQL allows clients to define the shape and structure of the response using a single endpoint. This flexibility reduces over-fetching and under-fetching of data, improving performance and efficiency. GraphQL is strongly typed, with a schema that defines the types of data available and the relationships between them, making it self-documenting and easier to work with. It supports real-time updates through subscriptions, making it ideal for dynamic applications like social media feeds or live dashboards. Widely adopted by companies like Facebook (where it was created), GitHub, and Shopify, GraphQL is a powerful tool for building scalable, flexible, and developer-friendly APIs for web and mobile applications.

POSTGRESQL.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: PostgreSQL is a powerful, open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) known for its reliability, extensibility, and compliance with SQL standards. It supports a wide range of advanced features, including complex queries, foreign keys, triggers, views, and transactional integrity, making it suitable for both small and large-scale applications. PostgreSQL also offers support for JSON, geospatial data, and full-text search, as well as extensibility through custom functions, data types, and procedural languages like PL/pgSQL. Its robust performance, ACID compliance, and strong community support make it a popular choice for developers building data-intensive applications, such as web apps, analytics platforms, and enterprise systems. PostgreSQL is highly scalable and integrates well with modern development frameworks and tools, making it a versatile and future-proof database solution.

MYSQL.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: MySQL is a widely-used, open-source relational database management system (RDBMS) known for its speed, reliability, and ease of use. It uses Structured Query Language (SQL) to manage and manipulate data, supporting features like transactions, indexing, and stored procedures. MySQL is a core component of the LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP/Perl/Python) stack, making it a popular choice for web applications, content management systems (e.g., WordPress), and e-commerce platforms. It offers strong performance for read-heavy workloads and is highly scalable, with support for replication and clustering. While it may lack some advanced features of other databases like PostgreSQL, MySQL's simplicity, widespread adoption, and strong community support make it a go-to solution for developers building small to medium-sized applications.

POSTMAN.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Postman is a popular collaboration platform for API development that simplifies the process of designing, testing, and documenting APIs. It provides a user-friendly interface for sending HTTP requests, inspecting responses, and debugging APIs, making it an essential tool for developers and testers. Postman supports features like automated testing with scripts, environment variables for dynamic configurations, and collections for organizing API requests. It also offers tools for mocking APIs, monitoring performance, and generating documentation. With its ability to integrate into CI/CD pipelines and support for team collaboration, Postman streamlines the API development lifecycle, making it a go-to tool for building, testing, and maintaining robust APIs.

DBEAVER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: DBeaver is a free, open-source universal database management tool that supports a wide range of databases, including MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQLite, Oracle, SQL Server, and more. It provides a user-friendly interface for database administration, query execution, and data manipulation, making it a versatile tool for developers and database administrators. DBeaver features advanced capabilities like schema editing, data export/import, ER diagram generation, and SQL syntax highlighting. It also supports cross-platform usage (Windows, macOS, Linux) and integrates with cloud databases. With its extensive database support, intuitive design, and powerful features, DBeaver is a popular choice for managing and interacting with databases efficiently.

SECURITY.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
Security is an essential component of any modern web application, and ensuring robust protection for both users and data is a top priority in my development process. Throughout my experience, I have worked extensively with Spring Security to implement secure authentication and authorization systems. Using Spring Security, I have been able to manage user authentication, enforce role-based access control, and protect sensitive data through encryption and secure protocols, ensuring that applications remain safe and compliant with security standards.

In addition to Spring Security, I’ve also integrated Auth0, a powerful identity management platform, to simplify user authentication, improve security, and enable Single Sign-On (SSO) across multiple platforms and applications. By leveraging Auth0's features, I can quickly implement secure login systems, manage user identities, and provide seamless access control across a range of services. These combined tools and techniques allow me to build highly secure and scalable applications that meet both functional and security requirements.

SPRING_SECURITY.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Spring Security is a powerful and highly customizable framework for securing Java applications, particularly those built with the Spring ecosystem. It provides comprehensive security features, including authentication, authorization, and protection against common vulnerabilities like CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) and session fixation. Spring Security supports a wide range of authentication mechanisms, such as form-based login, OAuth2, LDAP, and JWT (JSON Web Tokens), making it adaptable to various use cases. It integrates seamlessly with Spring Boot, enabling developers to easily secure REST APIs, web applications, and microservices. With its robust architecture and extensible design, Spring Security is a go-to solution for implementing enterprise-grade security in Java applications.

AUTH0.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Auth0 is a leading identity and access management (IAM) platform that simplifies authentication and authorization for applications. Acquired by Okta in 2021, it enables secure user login through features like single sign-on (SSO), multi-factor authentication (MFA), passwordless login, and social logins (e.g., Google, Facebook). Auth0 supports enterprise identity providers, including SAML, LDAP, and Active Directory, making it versatile for businesses of all sizes. Its Universal Identity Platform centralizes authentication across web, mobile, and legacy systems, ensuring seamless user experiences. Auth0 prioritizes security with features like anomaly detection, brute force protection, and breached password screening. Highly customizable, it allows developers to tailor login pages and workflows to meet specific needs. With developer-friendly APIs, SDKs, and compliance with GDPR, HIPAA, and CCPA, Auth0 is a trusted solution for enhancing security, improving user experiences, and streamlining identity management in modern applications.

HOSTING.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
Hosting is a critical component for ensuring the reliability, scalability, and performance of web applications. I have experience working with Hostinger VPS and AWS to deploy and manage applications, ensuring they are highly available and scalable. Whether for personal projects or large-scale enterprise solutions, these platforms provide the flexibility and power needed to handle infrastructure management, auto-scaling, and load balancing.

For streamlined deployment and environment consistency, I utilize Docker, which allows me to create isolated application containers, ensuring that the application runs seamlessly across various environments. Additionally, Nginx serves as a powerful reverse proxy and web server, optimizing performance and load balancing, while enhancing the overall speed of the applications I deploy.

Together, these tools enable me to provide efficient and reliable hosting solutions that deliver high performance, scalability, and availability for any web application.

HOSTINGER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Hostinger is a global web hosting provider known for offering affordable and reliable hosting solutions for individuals and businesses. It provides a range of services, including shared hosting, cloud hosting, VPS hosting, and domain registration, catering to various needs from small personal websites to larger business applications. Hostinger is praised for its user-friendly control panel, fast server performance, and 24/7 customer support. It also offers a website builder and one-click installations for popular platforms like WordPress, making it accessible for beginners. With data centers worldwide, competitive pricing, and a 99.9% uptime guarantee, Hostinger is a popular choice for those seeking cost-effective and scalable hosting solutions.

AWS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is a comprehensive and widely-used cloud computing platform offered by Amazon, providing a vast array of on-demand services, including computing power, storage, databases, machine learning, analytics, and networking. AWS enables businesses to build, deploy, and scale applications quickly and cost-effectively without the need for physical infrastructure. Popular services include EC2 (Elastic Compute Cloud) for virtual servers, S3 (Simple Storage Service) for scalable storage, and Lambda for serverless computing. Known for its reliability, scalability, and global infrastructure, AWS supports millions of customers worldwide, from startups to enterprises. Its pay-as-you-go pricing model, extensive documentation, and robust ecosystem make it a leading choice for cloud-based solutions.

DOCKER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Docker is an open-source platform designed to simplify the development, deployment, and running of applications using containerization. Containers package an application and its dependencies into a single, lightweight, and portable unit, ensuring consistency across different environments. Docker enables developers to build, ship, and run applications efficiently, reducing the "it works on my machine" problem. It supports a wide range of programming languages and frameworks and integrates with tools like Kubernetes for orchestration and scaling. Docker's ecosystem includes Docker Hub, a repository for sharing container images, and Docker Compose for managing multi-container applications. Widely used in DevOps and cloud-native development, Docker streamlines workflows, improves scalability, and enhances application portability.

NGINX.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Nginx is a high-performance, open-source web server, reverse proxy, and load balancer known for its efficiency and scalability. It is widely used to serve web content, handle HTTP requests, and distribute traffic across multiple servers to ensure high availability and reliability. Nginx excels at handling concurrent connections with minimal resource usage, making it ideal for high-traffic websites and applications. It also supports features like SSL/TLS termination, caching, and compression, enhancing performance and security. Often used in conjunction with application servers like Node.js or Django, Nginx is a critical component of modern web infrastructure, powering many high-profile sites and applications worldwide.

PROGRAMMING_LANGUAGES.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
As a developer, I have experience working with a wide range of programming languages, each offering unique advantages for different types of projects.

I am proficient in JavaScript and TypeScript, which I use for both front-end and back-end development to create dynamic and interactive web applications. Java has been a key language in my back-end development, particularly with the Spring Framework, where I focus on building scalable, secure, and high-performance systems. In addition to these, I have experience with Python, a versatile language often used for scripting, automation, and back-end development. For performance-critical applications and low-level system programming, I also work with C and C++, which provide the control and efficiency needed for high-performance computing and embedded systems.

By combining these languages, I can tackle a wide variety of development challenges, from web applications to system-level programming, ensuring the right tools are used for each task.

JAVASCRIPT.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: JavaScript is a versatile, high-level programming language primarily used for adding interactivity and dynamic behavior to web pages. As one of the core technologies of the web, alongside HTML and CSS, JavaScript enables developers to create responsive user interfaces, handle events, manipulate the DOM (Document Object Model), and communicate with servers via APIs. It supports both procedural and object-oriented programming paradigms and has a vast ecosystem of libraries and frameworks, such as React, Angular, and Vue.js, for building modern web applications. With the advent of Node.js, JavaScript can also be used for server-side development, making it a full-stack language. Its widespread adoption, active community, and continuous evolution through standards like ECMAScript have solidified JavaScript as an essential tool for web development and beyond.

TYPESCRIPT.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: TypeScript is a strongly typed, open-source programming language developed by Microsoft that builds on JavaScript by adding static type definitions. It enables developers to catch errors during development, improve code readability, and enhance tooling support with features like autocompletion and refactoring. TypeScript code is transpiled into plain JavaScript, making it compatible with all JavaScript environments, including browsers, Node.js, and Deno. It supports modern JavaScript features and introduces additional constructs like interfaces, enums, and decorators, making it ideal for large-scale applications. TypeScript is widely used with popular frameworks like Angular, React, and Vue.js, offering a more robust and maintainable development experience while retaining the flexibility of JavaScript.

JAVA.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Java is a versatile, object-oriented programming language known for its "write once, run anywhere" philosophy, thanks to its platform-independent nature through the Java Virtual Machine (JVM). It is widely used for building enterprise-level applications, web services, mobile apps (Android), and large-scale systems. Java emphasizes strong typing, robustness, and security, with features like garbage collection, exception handling, and multithreading. Its extensive standard library and rich ecosystem of frameworks, such as Spring and Hibernate, make it a popular choice for developers. Java's long-standing presence, cross-platform compatibility, and strong community support have solidified its position as one of the most widely used programming languages in the world.

PYTHON.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its simplicity, readability, and versatility. It supports multiple programming paradigms, including procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming, making it suitable for a wide range of applications, from web development and data analysis to artificial intelligence and scientific computing. Python's extensive standard library and rich ecosystem of third-party packages, such as NumPy, Pandas, Django, and TensorFlow, enable developers to build powerful applications with minimal effort. Its clear syntax and dynamic typing make it an excellent choice for beginners, while its scalability and performance optimization options cater to advanced users. Python's widespread adoption, active community, and cross-platform compatibility have made it one of the most popular programming languages globally.

C_PLUS_PLUS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: C and C++ are powerful, general-purpose programming languages widely used for system programming, game development, and performance-critical applications. C, known for its efficiency and low-level control, is the foundation of many operating systems and embedded systems. C++ builds on C by adding object-oriented features like classes, inheritance, and polymorphism, as well as modern enhancements such as templates and the Standard Template Library (STL). Both languages offer fine-grained control over memory management and hardware, making them ideal for applications requiring high performance, such as game engines, real-time systems, and high-frequency trading platforms. Despite their steep learning curve, C and C++ remain essential tools for developers working on resource-constrained or performance-intensive projects.

PHP.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: PHP is a widely-used, open-source server-side scripting language designed for web development. It is particularly well-suited for creating dynamic web pages and applications, often embedded within HTML. PHP powers many popular content management systems (CMS) like WordPress, Drupal, and Joomla, as well as frameworks like Laravel and Symfony. It supports a variety of databases, including MySQL and PostgreSQL, and integrates seamlessly with web servers like Apache and Nginx. Known for its ease of use, flexibility, and extensive documentation, PHP is a popular choice for building everything from small websites to large-scale web applications. Despite criticism of its older design, modern PHP versions have introduced significant improvements, making it a robust and efficient tool for web development.

AI.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
Artificial Intelligence (AI) is revolutionizing the development process by enhancing productivity and streamlining workflows. I regularly use AI tools that assist in automating repetitive tasks, generating code suggestions, and offering insights for problem-solving. These tools help me save time by providing context-aware suggestions, improving the speed and quality of my coding process. Additionally, they enable me to navigate complex codebases more effectively, making it easier to find relevant information and solve technical challenges.

Beyond development, I am also exploring AI’s potential in production and graphic design tools. The ability to automate tasks, optimize workflows, and enhance creativity is still in its early stages, but I am excited about the possibilities. As AI continues to evolve, I look forward to integrating it more deeply into my work to improve both development practices and visual content creation.

DEEPSEEK.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: DeepSeek is a cutting-edge artificial intelligence company focused on advancing the development of Artificial General Intelligence (AGI). Founded in 2023, DeepSeek aims to create intelligent systems capable of performing a wide range of tasks with human-like adaptability and reasoning. The company emphasizes research and innovation in machine learning, natural language processing, and cognitive computing to push the boundaries of AI capabilities. With a mission to make AGI a reality, DeepSeek is at the forefront of developing technologies that could revolutionize industries such as healthcare, education, and automation. Its commitment to ethical AI and groundbreaking research positions DeepSeek as a key player in the global AI landscape.

CHATGPT.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: ChatGPT is an advanced language model developed by OpenAI, designed to generate human-like text and engage in natural conversations. Built on the GPT (Generative Pre-trained Transformer) architecture, it leverages deep learning techniques to understand and respond to a wide range of queries, from casual chat to complex problem-solving. ChatGPT can assist with tasks like writing, coding, learning, and brainstorming, making it a versatile tool for individuals and businesses. It is trained on vast amounts of data and fine-tuned for safety and accuracy, though it may occasionally produce errors or require user guidance. With its ability to simulate human-like interaction, ChatGPT has become a popular AI assistant for applications in customer support, education, content creation, and more.

COPILOT.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Copilot is an AI-powered code completion tool developed by GitHub in collaboration with OpenAI. It integrates directly into code editors like Visual Studio Code, providing real-time suggestions, autocompletion, and even entire code snippets based on context and natural language prompts. Powered by OpenAI's Codex model, Copilot is trained on vast amounts of public code, enabling it to assist with a wide range of programming languages and frameworks. It helps developers write code faster, reduce errors, and learn best practices by offering intelligent recommendations. While it enhances productivity, users should review and validate its suggestions to ensure accuracy and security. Copilot is widely used by developers to streamline coding workflows and accelerate software development.

VERSIONING.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
Version control is an essential practice for managing and tracking changes in code over time, and I rely on a variety of tools to ensure smooth collaboration and efficient code management. Git is my go-to version control system, allowing me to track changes, branch, merge, and manage the history of codebases effectively. I use GitHub and GitLab for hosting repositories, collaborating with teams, and leveraging additional features such as issue tracking, continuous integration, and code reviews.

Additionally, I work with Azure DevOps for version control and CI/CD pipelines in enterprise environments, ensuring automated builds, tests, and deployments. These tools help me maintain code quality, streamline collaboration, and ensure that every project is well-organized, up-to-date, and easy to manage throughout its lifecycle.

GIT.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Git is a distributed version control system that enables developers to track changes in code, collaborate seamlessly, and maintain a complete history of a project. By allowing each developer to work with a full copy of the repository locally, Git offers fast, flexible workflows for branching, merging, and managing commits. It supports efficient collaboration, as developers can work independently on different features or bug fixes and later integrate their changes without conflict. Git’s powerful tools and flexibility make it the go-to system for modern software development, ensuring smooth and organized project management.

GITHUB.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: GitHub is a web-based platform for version control and collaboration, primarily used for software development. Built on Git, it allows developers to host, review, and manage code repositories, making it easier to collaborate on projects with teams. Key features include pull requests, issue tracking, code review, and project management tools, which streamline the development workflow. GitHub also supports continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) through integrations with tools like GitHub Actions. It is widely used by open-source projects and enterprises alike, fostering a global community of developers who share and contribute to code. With its user-friendly interface and robust ecosystem, GitHub has become an essential tool for modern software development and collaboration.

GITLAB.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: GitLab is a comprehensive, web-based DevOps platform that provides tools for the entire software development lifecycle, from planning and coding to testing, deployment, and monitoring. Built on Git, it offers version control, continuous integration/continuous deployment (CI/CD), and collaboration features like issue tracking, code review, and project management. GitLab is available as both a cloud-hosted service and a self-managed solution, giving teams flexibility in how they deploy and use it. Known for its all-in-one approach, GitLab integrates seamlessly with various tools and supports a wide range of programming languages and frameworks. It is widely used by development teams to streamline workflows, improve productivity, and deliver high-quality software faster.

AZURE.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Azure is a comprehensive cloud computing platform and service offered by Microsoft, designed to help businesses build, deploy, and manage applications and services through a global network of data centers. It provides a wide range of cloud services, including computing power, storage, networking, databases, artificial intelligence (AI), machine learning (ML), Internet of Things (IoT), and developer tools, all accessible on a pay-as-you-go basis. Azure supports a variety of programming languages, frameworks, and operating systems, making it highly flexible and scalable for diverse workloads, from small startups to large enterprises. With robust security, compliance, and hybrid cloud capabilities, Azure enables organizations to innovate faster, reduce costs, and achieve their digital transformation goals. It is widely used for hosting web applications, running virtual machines, analyzing big data, and building intelligent solutions, making it a key player in the cloud computing industry.

TOOLS.SECTION_DESCRIPTION: In the fast-paced world of software development, using the right tools can significantly boost productivity, streamline workflows, and enhance the overall quality of the final product. Over the course of my work, I’ve relied on various tools that assist in every aspect of the development process. These tools help me optimize efficiency, tackle complex tasks, and ensure smooth integration. Whether it's for code analysis, performance profiling, or automation, these tools empower me to deliver high-quality, well-optimized applications while fostering better collaboration and continuous improvement.

GOOGLE_ANALYTICS.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Google Analytics is a powerful web analytics tool provided by Google that helps businesses and website owners track and analyze user behavior on their websites and apps. It provides insights into metrics like page views, bounce rates, session duration, and conversion rates, enabling users to understand audience demographics, traffic sources, and user engagement. Google Analytics offers features like real-time reporting, goal tracking, and e-commerce tracking, making it suitable for both small websites and large enterprises. It integrates seamlessly with other Google tools like Google Ads and Search Console, as well as third-party platforms. With its robust data visualization and customizable dashboards, Google Analytics is a go-to solution for optimizing website performance, improving marketing strategies, and making data-driven decisions.

JIRA.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Jira is a powerful project management and issue tracking software developed by Atlassian, widely used by teams to plan, track, and manage their work efficiently. It is particularly popular among software development teams for agile project management, but its flexibility makes it suitable for various industries and use cases. Jira allows users to create tasks, assign them to team members, set priorities, and track progress through customizable workflows. Key features include Scrum and Kanban boards, backlog management, sprint planning, and detailed reporting tools. With its robust integration capabilities, Jira seamlessly connects with other tools like Confluence, Bitbucket, and Slack, enhancing collaboration and productivity. Its highly customizable nature enables teams to tailor the platform to their specific needs, making it a versatile solution for managing projects of any size or complexity.

FIGMA.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION: Figma is a cloud-based design and prototyping tool widely used for creating user interfaces, web designs, and interactive prototypes. It enables real-time collaboration, allowing multiple designers to work on the same project simultaneously, making it ideal for teams. Figma supports vector editing, design systems, and responsive design, with features like components, constraints, and auto-layout to streamline workflows. Its prototyping capabilities allow designers to create interactive mockups and share them with stakeholders for feedback. Figma is platform-agnostic, running in browsers and offering desktop apps for macOS and Windows. With its intuitive interface, robust collaboration tools, and seamless integration with other design and development tools, Figma has become a favorite among UI/UX designers and product teams.

DESCRIPTIONS.ABWERKT:
AB Werkt is a cooperative organization specializing in workforce solutions across various sectors, including agriculture, industry, logistics, food, and green spaces. They provide professional staffing services, connecting employers with skilled employees while ensuring smooth and efficient workforce management. Their mission is to streamline labor processes, enhance productivity, and create value for both employers and employees.

To support their operations, we developed a comprehensive employee app designed to improve communication, task management, and overall efficiency. Built with React, the app features an intuitive and user-friendly interface that allows employees to access their schedules, tasks, and essential work-related information in real time. This centralized platform empowers employees to stay informed and organized, reducing administrative overhead and enhancing productivity.

For administrators, we created a custom CMS (Content Management System) using Angular, enabling efficient management of content, user permissions, and system configurations. The CMS provides administrators with the tools they need to oversee operations, update information, and ensure smooth functionality across the platform.

The backend, powered by Django, ensures secure, scalable, and efficient data handling. It integrates robust authentication mechanisms, business logic, and API services to support both the employee app and the CMS. This architecture ensures reliable performance, even as the platform scales to accommodate growing user demands.

By combining React for the front-end, Angular for the CMS, and Django for the back-end, we delivered a cohesive solution that aligns with AB Werkt’s goals of improving workforce management and operational efficiency. This project not only streamlined internal processes but also enhanced the overall experience for both employees and administrators, demonstrating the power of technology to transform workforce solutions.
DESCRIPTIONS.LENTO:
Lento.eu is an innovative platform designed to improve the living conditions of international workers in the Netherlands by offering fair and transparent housing solutions. Acting as a bridge between tenants and hosts, it simplifies the rental process while ensuring compliance with housing standards, making it easier for individuals to find safe and reliable accommodations.

I joined the project at The Brink, a dynamic and innovative digital agency based in Amsterdam, which provided the development team for Ponthus, the company managing the initiative. At The Brink, I focused on front-end development using React, crafting an intuitive and responsive user interface that laid the foundation for the platform. This experience was incredibly enriching, as the agency’s emphasis on creativity, collaboration, and cutting-edge solutions deeply influenced my approach to development.

Later, I transitioned to working directly with Ponthus, a strategic company located in Elsloo, Netherlands. While I remained a front-end developer, this shift allowed me to become more involved in the back-end processes and gain a deeper understanding of the system’s architecture. Working alongside experienced developers and data scientists at Ponthus provided valuable mentorship and insights, helping me improve my technical knowledge while contributing to a secure and scalable infrastructure for managing user data, rental agreements, and property listings.

Through this project, I gained strong technical expertise while navigating both creative and strategic environments. I contributed to a platform that streamlines complex housing procedures, promotes accessibility, and ensures a seamless experience for tenants and landlords. This experience not only honed my development skills but also gave me valuable insights into creating solutions that address real-world challenges, ultimately improving the lives of international workers in the Netherlands.
DESCRIPTIONS.MOCO_XTA:
My portfolio is a cutting-edge, immersive web experience designed to showcase my skills as a full-stack developer and 3D enthusiast. Built with Next.js for seamless server-side rendering and performance optimization, the portfolio combines dynamic 3D visuals, interactive animations, and robust back-end functionality to create a unique and engaging user experience. At its core, the portfolio leverages Three.js, React Three Fiber, and WebGL/WebGPU to bring stunning, interactive 3D environments to life. These environments feature custom 3D models and animations crafted in Blender, demonstrating my ability to bridge 3D design with modern web development.

To enhance user interactions, I integrated GSAP (GreenSock Animation Platform) for fluid, high-performance animations that add depth and storytelling to the experience. The portfolio also supports multilingual accessibility through Next Intl, ensuring it resonates with a global audience. The responsive and visually appealing interface was designed using Photoshop and Illustrator, with Formik powering intuitive and user-friendly forms for seamless visitor interactions.

On the back end, I built a secure and scalable system using the Spring Framework and Spring Security, ensuring data protection and high performance. The portfolio’s database is managed with PostgreSQL, providing reliable data storage and retrieval. To streamline development and deployment, I containerized the application using Docker, ensuring consistency across environments and simplifying the deployment process. To track user engagement and optimize performance, I integrated Google Analytics, and I managed application state efficiently with Redux for a consistent and predictable user experience.

The portfolio is deployed on a Hostinger VPS, configured with NGINX for optimal performance, security, and scalability. This combination of technologies and tools reflects my commitment to creating professional, high-quality applications that are both functional and visually captivating. By seamlessly integrating 3D design, front-end interactivity, and back-end robustness, my portfolio not only showcases my work but also tells a compelling story about my journey, skills, and passion for innovation.
DESCRIPTIONS.OPENCLASSROOMS:
OpenClassrooms is a leading online education platform offering professional courses in various fields, such as web development, data science, and design. With a strong focus on practical learning, it allows students to work on real-world projects and gain hands-on experience with modern technologies. Its flexible and accessible model helps those looking to advance their careers or acquire new skills.

I chose OpenClassrooms because of its origins as "Le Site du Zéro," an educational platform founded in 1999 by Mathieu Nebra and Pierre Dubuc, which became an essential resource for many developers in France. This site was the starting point for numerous French programmers, including myself, in learning how to code.

During my training at OpenClassrooms, I specialized in back-end development, focusing on Spring Framework. Through a comprehensive curriculum, I learned to build scalable web applications, integrate databases, optimize server performance, and apply best security practices. This program allowed me to deepen my understanding of modern architectures and develop robust and maintainable systems.

Additionally, I gained experience in integrating back-end technologies with front-end frameworks like React and Angular, as well as creating real-time 3D interfaces using WebGL and Three.js. By working on full-stack projects with frameworks like Django and Spring, and utilizing tools like Git and Docker, I became a versatile developer capable of tackling complex challenges in both areas. This experience has equipped me to deliver comprehensive and efficient solutions in modern web development.
DESCRIPTIONS.HUNDRED_HANDS:
100Hands is a luxury fashion brand based in Amsterdam, renowned for its exquisite, handmade shirts that embody the pinnacle of craftsmanship. Each shirt requires 34 hours of meticulous handwork, blending timeless design with premium materials to create a symbol of refined elegance. The brand takes pride in offering made-to-order, tailored shirts that reflect both exceptional style and unparalleled quality. With a strong commitment to authenticity and artisanal excellence, 100Hands delivers shirts that offer a truly unique and luxurious wearing experience.

For this project, we developed a real-time 3D configurator for their shirts, enabling customers to customize their designs online in an interactive and immersive way. Leveraging React for the front-end and Spring for the back-end, we built a seamless and engaging platform. Using Blender and Substance Painter for 3D modeling and texturing, we created a dynamic tool that allows users to visualize and personalize every detail of their shirts in real time before making a purchase. This innovative solution not only enhances the customer experience but also aligns perfectly with 100Hands’ dedication to craftsmanship and luxury.
DESCRIPTIONS.WPME:
WPME is a dynamic company based in the Netherlands, specializing in media and entertainment services. With a focus on delivering high-quality productions, WPME stands out in the industry by creating impactful and memorable experiences that leave a lasting impression.

For WPME, we developed a presentation website that showcases their services in a visually captivating and interactive way. The front-end was built using React, React Three Fiber, and WebGL, integrating 3D elements and animations directly into the website to create an engaging and immersive user experience. On the back-end, we utilized the Spring Framework to provide a secure, scalable environment for managing content and user data, ensuring smooth performance and reliability.

This project allowed us to combine cutting-edge 3D technologies with a seamless, responsive design, resulting in a unique digital platform that captures the essence of WPME’s brand. The website not only enhances their digital presence but also reflects their commitment to innovation and quality in the media and entertainment industry.

THREE_D.SECTION_DESCRIPTION:
Welcome to the 3D section, where you'll find a curated collection of essential links, tools, and documentation for working with WebGPU, WebGL, Three.js, React Three Fiber, and Blender. Whether you're a beginner exploring real-time 3D graphics or an experienced developer building advanced interactive experiences, this section provides everything you need to enhance your workflow.

From low-level GPU programming with WebGPU and WebGL to high-level 3D scene management with Three.js and React Three Fiber, you'll find resources to help you create stunning, performant 3D applications. Additionally, we've included useful Blender resources for modeling, texturing, and rendering, ensuring you have the right tools to bring your 3D visions to life.

BLENDER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION:
Blender is a powerful open-source 3D creation suite that supports modeling, sculpting, animation, rigging, rendering, compositing, video editing, and simulation. It is widely used in industries like animation, VFX, game development, and 3D printing.

Blender features a robust toolset, including procedural modeling, physics simulations, and a non-destructive modifier stack. It supports multiple rendering engines, including the real-time Eevee and the physically accurate Cycles. The software also integrates with Python for scripting and automation.

With an active community and continuous updates, Blender remains a leading choice for professionals and hobbyists seeking a free, feature-rich 3D software solution.
BLENDER.VIDEO_INTRODUCTION_DESCRIPTION: In the 2017 interview titled "Money doesn't interest me", Ton Roosendaal, the creator of the open-source 3D software Blender, discusses various aspects of the software's development and his philosophy. The interview covers topics such as the origins of Blender, early design decisions, and Roosendaal's vision for its future. He emphasizes his disinterest in monetary gain, focusing instead on fostering a collaborative community and advancing open-source development. The conversation provides insights into the challenges and successes encountered in building and maintaining Blender as a leading tool in the 3D graphics industry.

BLENDER_ORG.DESCRIPTION: The Blender.org Documentation is the official resource for learning and understanding Blender's features, tools, and workflows. It provides comprehensive guides on modeling, sculpting, texturing, animation, rendering, compositing, scripting, and more. The documentation includes detailed explanations, step-by-step tutorials, and API references for developers looking to extend Blender with Python. Continuously updated by the Blender community and developers, it serves as an essential guide for both beginners and professionals seeking to master Blender’s capabilities.

BLENDER.DESCRIPTION: The Blender YouTube channel is the official hub for Blender, the open-source 3D creation suite. It features tutorials, developer updates, showcase reels, and insights into new features and releases. The channel highlights community projects, industry use cases, and behind-the-scenes looks at Blender’s development. Whether you're a beginner or a professional, the Blender YouTube channel provides valuable content to help users explore and master the software.

BLENDER_GURU.DESCRIPTION: Blender Guru is a YouTube channel by Andrew Price, dedicated to teaching Blender through high-quality tutorials on modeling, texturing, lighting, and rendering. Known for the iconic "Donut Tutorial", the channel helps beginners and advanced users master 3D design with a focus on realism and industry techniques. In addition to tutorials, Blender Guru offers insights into Blender's future, product reviews, and practical tips, making it a go-to resource for 3D artists worldwide.

DEFAULT_CUBE.DESCRIPTION: Default Cube is a YouTube channel focused on Blender, 3D art, and industry insights, hosted by George Pavlovich. The channel features thought-provoking discussions, critiques, and deep dives into Blender’s ecosystem, including its strengths, limitations, and the broader world of 3D graphics. Unlike traditional tutorial channels, Default Cube offers commentary on topics like Blender's role in the industry, software comparisons, and the realities of working as a 3D artist. With a mix of humor, analysis, and community engagement, it provides a unique perspective for both Blender enthusiasts and professional artists.

REACT_THREE_FIBER.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION:
React Three Fiber is a powerful React renderer for Three.js, allowing developers to build and manage 3D scenes in the browser using React's declarative programming model. By integrating Three.js with React, React Three Fiber provides an intuitive and efficient way to work with 3D graphics, making it easier to manage complex 3D objects, animations, and interactions within a React application.

Instead of using the traditional imperative approach to Three.js, where you manually manipulate the scene graph, React Three Fiber leverages React's component-based architecture. This means you can define 3D objects, cameras, lights, and animations as React components, enabling a more organized, scalable, and maintainable approach to 3D development. With support for hooks, state management, and lifecycle methods, React Three Fiber integrates seamlessly into your existing React projects, allowing for dynamic updates and smooth user experiences. Whether you're building interactive visualizations, immersive environments, or games, React Three Fiber offers a modern, React-friendly way to interact with 3D content.

REACT_THREE_FIBER.DESCRIPTION: The official documentation for React Three Fiber provides detailed information on how to get started with the library, including installation instructions, examples, and API references.

REACT_THREE_DREI.DESCRIPTION: Drei is a collection of useful helpers and abstractions for React Three Fiber, designed to simplify common tasks and streamline the development process. It includes components for lighting, cameras, controls, and more, making it easier to create complex 3D scenes with React Three Fiber.

REACT_THREE_POSTPROCESSING.DESCRIPTION: React Three Postprocessing is a library for applying post-processing effects to 3D graphics using React Three Fiber. It provides a set of high-level components and utilities for applying various post-processing effects, such as bloom, chromatic aberration, and depth of field.

REACT_THREE_RAPIER.DESCRIPTION: Rapier is a collection of React Three Fiber components and hooks that simplify the creation of physics-based simulations and interactions in 3D scenes. It provides a range of features for working with physics engines, collision detection, and rigid bodies, enabling developers to create realistic and interactive 3D environments.

REACT_THREE_CANNON.DESCRIPTION: React Three Cannon is a collection of React Three Fiber components and hooks that simplify the creation of physics-based simulations and interactions in 3D scenes using the Cannon.js physics engine. WEBGPU.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION:

WebGPU enables developers to leverage advanced graphics features like compute shaders, explicit memory management, and parallel processing, making it ideal for real-time 3D rendering, machine learning, and high-performance computing in the browser.

With a streamlined API and support for better resource management, reduced CPU overhead, and enhanced rendering techniques, WebGPU provides a significant performance boost over its predecessors. It integrates seamlessly with frameworks like Three.js and Babylon.js, unlocking new possibilities for complex visualizations, gaming, and AI-powered applications. As browsers continue to adopt WebGPU, it is set to revolutionize web-based graphics and computation, bringing desktop-level performance to modern web applications.

WEBGL.PARAGRAPH_DESCRIPTION:
WebGL (Web Graphics Library) is a low-level JavaScript API that enables rendering high-performance 2D and 3D graphics directly in web browsers without requiring additional plugins. Based on OpenGL ES 2.0, WebGL provides direct access to the GPU, allowing for hardware-accelerated rendering of complex graphics. It integrates seamlessly with HTML5’s canvas element and supports cross-platform compatibility, making it a powerful tool for developing interactive applications, games, simulations, and data visualizations. WebGL uses a shader-based pipeline with GLSL (OpenGL Shading Language) for programmable vertex and fragment shaders, offering developers fine control over rendering but requiring manual handling of buffers, textures, and transformations.

While WebGL is powerful, its complexity has led to the development of high-level libraries like Three.js, Babylon.js, and PixiJS, which simplify 3D and 2D rendering. These frameworks provide built-in tools for managing lighting, shadows, physics, and animation, making WebGL more accessible to developers. WebGL is widely used in game development, VR/AR applications (via WebXR), real-time data visualization, and architectural rendering, allowing users to experience interactive 3D content directly in the browser. With its ability to harness GPU acceleration and its broad compatibility, WebGL remains a key technology for delivering immersive, real-time graphics on the web.
